mapping.atlantis-free: This is a solver implementing a CP-SAT approach, combining SAT learning with MILP-style reasoning to efficiently solve large-scale scheduling and routing models.
mapping.cbc-free: This is a SAT and Max-SAT solver aimed at optimization-centric Boolean reasoning, providing clause learning and heuristics suitable for decision and cost-based models.
mapping.choco-solver__cp_-free: This is an open-source MILP solver specializing in integer and linear optimization, widely used as a robust and lightweight alternative to commercial engines.
mapping.choco-solver__cp_-par: This is a FlatZinc interpreter that integrates with the MiniZinc toolchain, combining local search with restarting strategies, global constraints, and lexicographic cost functions.
mapping.choco-solver__cp-sat_-free: This is a solver that unifies mixed-integer programming and constraint programming with nonlinear extensions, known for strong presolve, cutting planes, and modeling flexibility.
mapping.chuffed-free: This is a free edition of a Prolog system that blends logic programming with constraint logic programming capabilities, enabling expressive models for combinatorial reasoning and inference.
mapping.cp_optimizer-free: This is a SAT/CP-hybrid solver integrated with a logic programming language, enabling concise modeling with tabling and pattern-based constructs for combinatorial tasks.
mapping.cplex-free: This is a constraint-based local search solver. It takes inspiration from Localizer, Comet, OscaR.cbls, Yuck, and Kangaroo.
mapping.gurobi-free: This is an open-source Java constraint programming solver providing advanced propagators and search heuristics, widely used in education and prototyping of discrete decision models.
mapping.highs-free: This is a free, high-performance constraint programming solver leveraging Lazy Clause Generation to combine SAT-like learning with traditional CP techniques, especially suited for rich scheduling and routing tasks.
mapping.huub-free: This is a free (typically academic) version of a commercial solver for LP, MILP, QP, and related problems, recognized for state-of-the-art performance, parallelization, and tuning tools.
mapping.izplus-free: This is a free constraint programming solver supporting expressive modeling and modern search heuristics, positioned for practical combinatorial decision and scheduling tasks.
mapping.jacop-free: This is a free configuration of a Java-based constraint programming toolkit supporting finite domain constraints and offering customizable search strategies for discrete optimization.
mapping.or-tools_cp-sat-free: This is a free edition of a constraint programming solver tailored for scheduling, planning, and sequencing, providing strong propagation and heuristic search.
mapping.or-tools_cp-sat_ls-free: This is an open-source suite for LP, MILP, and QP that includes simplex and interior-point methods, designed to be lightweight, modern, and easy to integrate into scientific workflows.
mapping.picatsat-free: This is a no-cost version of a solver supporting LP, MILP, and QP, known for fast branch-and-bound, presolve, and cutting-plane methods, and commonly used in academia.
mapping.pumpkin-free: This is a free solver from the MiniZinc ecosystem that blends constraint and logic programming, supports expressive modeling, and integrates cleanly with MiniZinc workflows.
mapping.scip-free: This is a free configuration of a Java-based constraint programming toolkit that exploits multi-threaded search, improving runtimes on hard combinatorial problems while retaining a flexible modeling interface.
mapping.sicstus_prolog-free: This is a mode that integrates constraint programming with SAT-style reasoning to handle complex and hybrid combinatorial models more efficiently in a free configuration.
mapping.yuck-free: This is a free solver implementing CP-SAT, combining SAT learning with MILP-style reasoning to efficiently solve large-scale scheduling and routing models.
